com.maverick.sshd.platform
Class AuthenticationProvider

java.lang.Object
  com.maverick.sshd.platform.AuthenticationProvider

public class AuthenticationProvider
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides an entry point for authenticating users. Each instance manages a single instance of an NativeAuthenticationProvider on behalf of the server.

Author:
Lee David Painter

registerSession

public void registerSession(byte[] sessionid,
                            java.lang.String username,
                            java.net.SocketAddress remoteAddr)
Called by the Authentication protocol when a new user attempts a logon. This prepares the authentication provider for home directory and group requests but does not log the user on.

Parameters:
sessionid - byte[]
username - String
remoteAddr - SocketAddress

getGroup

public java.lang.String getGroup(byte[] sessionid)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Get the group associated with a given session id. This is called by the server to determine the group of the user. The returned value is never used by the server itself but it may be supplied to the NativeFileSystemProvider and therefore the value returned should preferably be readable as it may be used in long filename readings.

Parameters:
sessionid -
Returns:
String
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getRemoteAddress

public static java.net.SocketAddress getRemoteAddress(byte[] sessionid)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
Get the remote address of a session. This will only return valid logged on sessions and will not work until a user has logged onto the system.

Parameters:
sessionid - byte[]
Returns:
SocketAddress
Throws:
java.io.IOException
